To ensure cybersecurity requirements are properly addressed/implemented in the software Cydecor delivers, the AppSecDev checklists must be reviewed, updated, and maintained.  There are 14 NRRE GOTS applications that consist of 4,004 requirements for review.  DISA releases updates to STIG checklists quarterly, but that doesn't always mean that the AppSecDev STIG checklist will receive updates.

Each of the NMETL Consumers will require an DST update which in other words we   MFOM in particular has made changes to the last version we sent them. Therefore they will require software development from their team to get the new code we provide them up and working.  Since they made modifcations we are not liable for the outcoming.  We will make our Lead Developer available to them to complete their portion of the connection.

TaskName: Ensure software assurance is conducted similarly
Notes: Recently became accountable for the A037, but currently unable to focus enough time on this area due to the LOE required to execute security impact analysis, develop associated use case MFR, and report the status of both work items weekly.  Objective is to adopt repeatable and sustainable processes/procedures from Fortify SME supporting Department of Homeland Security Science & Technology (Battelle's prime on this contract).  Success will be realizing an enterprise standard for how NRRE performs these activities.

TaskName: SOP for external dynamic code scans
Notes: There is an OPORD requiring these scans be executed against web applications that are "whitelisted" or "publicly accesible". It is essential to implement an internal SOP for both analyzing and reporting the findings that are assocaited with dynamic code testing for NRRM.  The remediation of dynamic code vulnerabilities varies based on the vulnerability and may require Operations Team, DISA, or the NRRM development team.

TaskName: Modernize file ingest and deploy historical readiness datamart
Notes: NRREBI R76 transitions our file ingest from SSIS to our modern big data infrastructure which is more efficient and cloud ready.  The historical datamart will provide rapid access to our most critical historical readiness data for BI products and for analysts responding to data calls from higher commands and mission partners. (5, 6, 7)
